meanings.definition: To touch or handle with the fingers.
meanings.sent1: She fingered the soft fabric to feel its texture.
meanings.sent2: He fingered the keys on the piano gently.
meanings.sent3: The kitten playfully fingered the yarn, unraveling it in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her memory fingered the edges of the old photograph, bringing back long-forgotten moments.
meanings.sent5: The artist fingered the clay, shaping it into a delicate sculpture.

meanings.definition: To identify or point out using the fingers.
meanings.sent1: The detective fingered the suspect in the lineup.
meanings.sent2: She fingered the correct answer on the test paper.
meanings.sent3: The child fingered the hidden object in the scavenger hunt with glee.
meanings.sent4: His intuition fingered the culprit among the crowd of onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The expert quickly fingered the flaw in the painting, pinpointing the restoration needed.
